Description: This registry defines the messages to use for resource events.

LicenseChanged.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a license has changed.
LicenseChanged.Description: Indicates that a license has changed.
LicenseChanged.Deprecated: This message has been deprecated in favor of `ResourceChanged`.
LicenseChanged.Resolution: See vendor specific instructions for specific actions.
LicenseChanged.Message: A license for '%1' has changed.  The following message was returned: '%2'.

ResourcePoweringOff.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the value of the PowerState property of a resource has changed to `PoweringOff`.  This message should not be used if the PowerState transition to `Off` will occur immediately.
ResourcePoweringOff.Description: Indicates that the power state of a resource has changed to powering off.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.

LicenseExpired.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a license has expired.
LicenseExpired.Description: Indicates that a license has expired.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant resource or service affected by the software license.
This argument shall contain the message returned from the license validation process or software.
LicenseExpired.Deprecated: This message has been deprecated in favor of `LicenseExpired` in the License Message Registry.
LicenseExpired.Resolution: See vendor specific instructions for specific actions.
ArgDescriptions: The message returned from the license validation process.
LicenseExpired.Message: A license for '%1' has expired.  The following message was returned: '%2'.

ResourceSelfTestFailed.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a self-test has failed.
ResourceSelfTestFailed.Description: Indicates that a self-test has failed.  Suggested resolution may be provided as OEM data.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the error message received as a result from the self-test.
ResourceSelfTestFailed.Resolution: See vendor specific instructions for specific actions.
ResourceSelfTestFailed.Message: A self-test has failed.  The following message was returned: '%1'.

ResourceCreated.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicates that all conditions of a successful creation operation have been met.
ResourceCreated.Description: Indicates that all conditions of a successful creation operation have been met.
ResourceCreated.Message: The resource has been created successfully.

URIForResourceChanged.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the URI for a resource has changed.
URIForResourceChanged.Description: Indicates that the URI for a resource has changed.  Examples for this would be physical component replacement or redistribution.
URIForResourceChanged.Message: The URI for the resource has changed.

ResourceSelfTestCompleted.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a self-test has completed.
ResourceSelfTestCompleted.Description: Indicates that a self-test has completed.

ResourcePoweringOn.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the value of the PowerState property of a resource has changed to `PoweringOn`.  This message should not be used if the PowerState transition to `On` will occur immediately.
ResourcePoweringOn.Description: Indicates that the power state of a resource has changed to powering on.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.

ResourceStatusChangedOK.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the health of a resource has changed to OK.
ResourceStatusChangedOK.Description: Indicates that the health of a resource has changed to OK.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the `Health` property for the relevant Redfish resource.  The values shall be used from the definition of the `Health` enumeration in the `Resource` schema.
ResourceStatusChangedOK.Message: The health of resource '%1' has changed to %2.

ResourceWarningThresholdCleared.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a specified resource property has cleared its warning threshold.
ResourceWarningThresholdCleared.Description: Indicates that a specified resource property has cleared its warning threshold.  Examples would be drive I/O errors, or network link errors.  Suggested resolution may be provided as OEM data.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant property from a Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the relevant error threshold.
ResourceWarningThresholdCleared.Message: The resource property %1 has cleared the warning threshold of value %2.

ResourceRemoved.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicates that all conditions of a successful remove operation have been met.
ResourceRemoved.Description: Indicates that all conditions of a successful remove operation have been met.
ResourceRemoved.Message: The resource has been removed successfully.

ResourceStatusChangedWarning.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the health of a resource has changed to Warning.
ResourceStatusChangedWarning.Description: Indicates that the health of a resource has changed to Warning.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the `Health` property for the relevant Redfish resource.  The values shall be used from the definition of the `Health` enumeration in the `Resource` schema.
ResourceStatusChangedWarning.Message: The health of resource `%1` has changed to %2.

LicenseAdded.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a license has been added.
LicenseAdded.Description: Indicates that a license has been added.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant resource or service affected by the software license.
This argument shall contain the message returned from the license validation process or software.
LicenseAdded.Deprecated: This message has been deprecated in favor of `LicenseAdded` in the License Message Registry.
LicenseAdded.Resolution: See vendor specific instructions for specific actions.
ArgDescriptions: The message returned from the license validation process.
LicenseAdded.Message: A license for '%1' has been added.  The following message was returned: '%2'.

ResourcePoweredOn.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the value of the PowerState property of a resource has changed to `On`.
ResourcePoweredOn.Description: Indicates that the power state of a resource has changed to powered on.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.

ResourceErrorsCorrected.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a specified resource property has corrected errors.
ResourceErrorsCorrected.Description: Indicates that a specified resource property has corrected errors.  Examples would be drive I/O errors, or network link errors.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant property from a Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain a description of the type of error encountered.
ResourceErrorsCorrected.Message: The resource property %1 has corrected errors of type '%2'.

ResourcePoweredOff.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the value of the PowerState property of a resource has changed to `Off`.
ResourcePoweredOff.Description: Indicates that the power state of a resource has changed to powered off.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.

ResourceWarningThresholdExceeded.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a specified resource property has exceeded its warning threshold.
ResourceWarningThresholdExceeded.Description: Indicates that a specified resource property has exceeded its warning threshold.  Examples would be drive I/O errors, or network link errors.  Suggested resolution may be provided as OEM data.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant property from a Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the relevant error threshold.
ResourceWarningThresholdExceeded.Message: The resource property %1 has exceeded its warning threshold of value %2.

ResourceErrorsDetected.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a specified resource property has detected errors.
ResourceErrorsDetected.Description: Indicates that a specified resource property has detected errors.  Examples would be drive I/O errors, or network link errors.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant property from a Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain a description of the type of error encountered.
ResourceErrorsDetected.Message: The resource property %1 has detected errors of type '%2'.

ResourceErrorThresholdExceeded.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a specified resource property has exceeded its error threshold.
ResourceErrorThresholdExceeded.Description: Indicates that a specified resource property has exceeded its error threshold.  Examples would be drive I/O errors, or network link errors.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant property from a Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the relevant error threshold.
ResourceErrorThresholdExceeded.Message: The resource property %1 has exceeded error threshold of value %2.

ResourceVersionIncompatible.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that an incompatible version of software has been detected.
ResourceVersionIncompatible.Description: Indicates that an incompatible version of software has been detected.  Examples may be after a component or system level software update.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant software component or package.  This might include both name and version information.
ResourceVersionIncompatible.Resolution: Compare the version of the resource with the compatible version of the software.
ArgDescriptions: The name of the software component.
ResourceVersionIncompatible.Message: An incompatible version of software '%1' has been detected.

ResourceErrorThresholdCleared.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a specified resource property has cleared its error threshold.
ResourceErrorThresholdCleared.Description: Indicates that a specified resource property has cleared its error threshold.  Examples would be drive I/O errors, or network link errors.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant property from a Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the relevant error threshold.
ResourceErrorThresholdCleared.Message: The resource property %1 has cleared the error threshold of value %2.

ResourcePaused.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the value of the PowerState property of a resource has changed to `Paused`.
ResourcePaused.Description: Indicates that the power state of a resource has changed to paused.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.

ResourceStatusChangedCritical.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the health of a resource has changed to Critical.
ResourceStatusChangedCritical.Description: Indicates that the health of a resource has changed to Critical.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the `Health` property for the relevant Redfish resource.  The values shall be used from the definition of the `Health` enumeration in the `Resource` schema.
ResourceStatusChangedCritical.Message: The health of resource `%1` has changed to %2.

ResourceStateChanged.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the value of the State property of a resource has changed.
ResourceStateChanged.Description: Indicates that the state of a resource has changed.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the name of the relevant Redfish resource.
This argument shall contain the value of the `State` property for the relevant Redfish resource.  The values shall be used from the definition of the `State` enumeration in the `Resource` schema.
ResourceStateChanged.Message: The state of resource `%1` has changed to %2.

ResourceChanged.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that one or more resource properties have changed.
ResourceChanged.Description: Indicates that one or more resource properties have changed.  This is not used whenever there is another event message for that specific change, such as only the state has changed.
ResourceChanged.Message: One or more resource properties have changed.

Name: Resource Event Message Registry
